applicability_reasoning: This regulation specifically pertains to advertisements that contain promotional or introductory interest rates and the requirement to disclose their expiry dates and subsequent rates. The document provided is a pension life cover scheme rules document that outlines the operational rules, definitions, and procedures for a company pension scheme. The document does not contain any advertising content or mention of promotional/introductory interest rates. The document is purely administrative and procedural in nature, focusing on scheme benefits, trustee duties, and operational guidelines for a pension life cover scheme. While the document does mention premiums and payments, it does not discuss any promotional or introductory rates that would fall under this regulatory requirement.
regulation_title: Promotional or introductory interest rates - required information
regulation_text: 84. A regulated entity shall ensure that where its advertisement specifies promotional or introductory interest rates, the advertisement clearly states the expiry date of that interest rate and provides an indication of the rate that will apply thereafter.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
